required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post Marketing Surveillance Study On Pregabalin (Lyrica) On Efficacy, Safety And Tolerability Of Pregabalin
clinical_study.official_title: Pregabalin (Lyrica) Action In Neuropathic Pain Syndrome (PAINS): A Post Marketing Surveillance Study On Efficacy, Safety And Tolerability Of Pregabalin

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted as a regulatory requirement post initial marketing authorization. This is primarily a safety study. This was an open label study and patients were enrolled once the decision to prescribe the medication was made by the Investigator.

primary_outcome.measure: Number and Severity of Adverse Events (All Causalities); Baseline to Final Visit (Week 4)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score
VAS Pain Score at Baseline (BL) and Second Visit
VAS Pain Score at Baseline and Final Visit
Physician's Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of Treatment Satisfaction at the Second and Final Visits
Patient's Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of Treatment Satisfaction at the Second and Final Visits
Physician's Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of Efficacy at Second and Final Visit
Patient's Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of Efficacy at Second and Final Visit
Physician's Clinical Global Impression (CGI) on Tolerability at Second and Final Viist
Patient's Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of Tolerability at Second and Final Visit

arm_group.description: This study was open-label with only one treatment group. Pregabalin was prescribed in accordance with usual clinical practice.

intervention.description: Pregabalin 75-150 mg BID for at least 2 weeks.

study_pop.textblock: Male or female, 18 years and above diagnosed with neuropathic pain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, 18 years old and above diagnosed with neuropathic pain.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that are pregnant and lactating; and patients with known hypersensitivity to pregabalin or its related components.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase 4 nationwide post-marketing surveillance study conducted between Sep 2006 and Aug 2008.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75-150 milligrams (mg) twice a day (BID) for at least 2 weeks; followed by optional upward dose titration to 600 mg/day at the discretion of the physician/investigator.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75-150 milligrams (mg) twice a day (BID) for at least 2 weeks; followed by optional upward dose titration to 600 mg/day at the discretion of the physician/investigator.

outcome.title: Number and Severity of Adverse Events (All Causalities); Baseline to Final Visit (Week 4)
outcome.description: Number and severity of adverse events, including serious adverse events. If the same subject had more than one occurance in the same preferred term event category, only the most severe occurrence was taken.
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who took at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75-150 milligrams (mg) twice a day (BID) for at least 2 weeks; followed by optional upward dose titration to 600 mg/day at the discretion of the physician/investigator.

measure.title: Number and Severity of Adverse Events (All Causalities); Baseline to Final Visit (Week 4)
measure.description: Number and severity of adverse events, including serious adverse events. If the same subject had more than one occurance in the same preferred term event category, only the most severe occurrence was taken.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who took at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score
outcome.description: Change from Baseline in 10 cm VAS pain score; 10-point pain intensity ordinal rating system: 0 = no pain, 1-3 = mild pain, 4-6 = moderate pain, 7-9 = severe pain, 10 = worst possible pain. Change = scores at second visit and final visit minus score at Baseline.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population: a subset of the safety population who underwent Baseline assessment, received study drug for at least 2 weeks, and had at least 1 follow-up visit. N = number of subjects with a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) pain score at Baseline Visit.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75-150 milligrams (mg) twice a day (BID) for at least 2 weeks; followed by optional upward dose titration to 600 mg/day at the discretion of the physician/investigator.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score
measure.description: Change from Baseline in 10 cm VAS pain score; 10-point pain intensity ordinal rating system: 0 = no pain, 1-3 = mild pain, 4-6 = moderate pain, 7-9 = severe pain, 10 = worst possible pain. Change = scores at second visit and final visit minus score at Baseline.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population: a subset of the safety population who underwent Baseline assessment, received study drug for at least 2 weeks, and had at least 1 follow-up visit. N = number of subjects with a Visual Analog Scale (VAS) pain score at Baseline Visit.

outcome.title: VAS Pain Score at Baseline (BL) and Second Visit
outcome.description: VAS Pain Score: 10 cm (10-point) pain intensity ordinal rating system: 0 = no pain, 1-3 = mild pain, 4-6 = moderate pain, 7-9 = severe pain, 10 = worst possible pain. Shift table shows the number of subjects with each pain intensity rating at the Second Visit by the number of subjects with each pain intensity rating at Baseline. Abbreviations: mod = moderate, sev = severe, wrst = worst, poss = possible, pn = pain, vst = visit .
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population: a subset of the safety population who underwent Baseline assessment, received study drug for at least 2 weeks, and had at least 1 follow-up visit. N=number of subjects in ITT population.

group.title: Pregabalin

measure.description: VAS Pain Score: 10 cm (10-point) pain intensity ordinal rating system: 0 = no pain, 1-3 = mild pain, 4-6 = moderate pain, 7-9 = severe pain, 10 = worst possible pain. Shift table shows the number of subjects with each pain intensity rating at the Second Visit by the number of subjects with each pain intensity rating at Baseline. Abbreviations: mod = moderate, sev = severe, wrst = worst, poss = possible, pn = pain, vst = visit .
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population: a subset of the safety population who underwent Baseline assessment, received study drug for at least 2 weeks, and had at least 1 follow-up visit. N=number of subjects in ITT population.

outcome.title: Physician's Clinical Global Impression (CGI) of Treatment Satisfaction at the Second and Final Visits
outcome.description: Physician's Clinical Global Impression of treatment satisfaction. Treatment satisfaction item of the CGI has a scale of five discrete score points: excellent, very good, good, fair and poor. Shift table shows the number of subjects with each score point rating at the Final Visit by the number of subjects with each score point rating at the Second Visit.
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population: a subset of the safety population who underwent Baseline assessment, received study drug for at least 2 weeks, and had at least 1 follow-up visit. N=number of subjects in ITT population.

outcome.title: Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events
outcome.description: Discontinuations due to adverse events by MedDRA system organ class and preferred term.
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who took at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75-150 milligrams (mg) twice a day (BID) for at least 2 weeks; followed by optional upward dose titration to 600 mg/day at the discretion of the physician/investigator.

measure.title: Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events
measure.description: Discontinuations due to adverse events by MedDRA system organ class and preferred term.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who took at least one dose of study medication.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events: Baseline through end of study (>= Week 4); serious adverse events: Baseline through and including 28 calendar days after the last administration of study medication (last administration was up to Week 4).

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: 75-150 milligrams (mg) twice a day (BID) for at least 2 weeks; followed by optional upward dose titration to 600 mg/day at the discretion of the physician/investigator.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
